item.title: Love is Like Having a Cat...and a Temporary Goodbye
item.description: [caption id="attachment_2504" align="alignright" width="225"] Heeeeey! Heeeey! Play with meee![/caption] One of the problems with being my age is that I forget how inexperienced I am and how much I have to learn about myself and life in general. I sometimes trick myself into thinking I can do anything and everything. I am wrong, but I still persist, sometimes to my detriment and that of others around me. Nowhere is that truth driven home more forcefully than in relationships and the delicate dance that is loving another person.

item.title: Go Until You Break
item.description:
[caption id="" align="alignright" width="300" caption="willem! on Flickr"][/caption]

There is a tendency in difficult times to stop before the end of our rope. Things start to get too hard and the voice in our head says, "We are almost finished. We'd better stop before we actually fail." And so we stop to rest, even though there was no concrete evidence of our immiment failure.

item.title: The Process of Living
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_974" align="alignright" width="225" caption="Source: mdezemery on flickr"][/caption]

"The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination." -Dan Millman, The Peaceful Warrior

One of the overriding themes that I refer to a lot is the idea that many important endeavors are ongoing. There is no end goal in mind, and having an end goal can often derail our efforts to improve. Instead, simply going through your routine, growing slowly and naturally, will get you where you want to go with less frustration and less pain.
